org.webcurator.core.util
Interface Auditor

All Known Implementing Classes:
AuditDAOUtil
public interface Auditor

The Auditor Interface defines the audit methods that an audit implementation must support.

Author:
bprice

ACTION_ACTIVATE_USER

static final java.lang.String ACTION_ACTIVATE_USER
Audit action used to identify the re-activation of a User within the WCT. This is when a user is taken from the inactive state and put into the active state

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ACTION_DEACTIVATE_USER

static final java.lang.String ACTION_DEACTIVATE_USER
Audit action used to identify the deactivation of a User within the WCT. This is when a user is taken from the active state and put into the inactive state

Method Detail

audit

void audit(java.lang.String subjectType,
           java.lang.Long subjectOid,
           java.lang.String action,
           java.lang.String message)
creates an audit record of the specified action

Parameters:
subjectType - the subject type that is effected by the action, e.g. TargetInstance
subjectOid - the subject oid that is effected by this action
action - the audit action
message - the text describing the action taken

audit

void audit(java.lang.String subjectType,
           java.lang.String action,
           java.lang.String message)
create an audit record of the specified action, when no user information is available

Parameters:
subjectType - the subject type that is effected by the action, e.g. TargetInstance
action - the audit action
message - the text describing the action taken

audit

void audit(User aUser,
           java.lang.String subjectType,
           java.lang.Long subjectOid,
           java.lang.String action,
           java.lang.String message)
creates an audit record of the specified action

Parameters:
aUser - the user that issues the action
subjectType - the subject type that is effected by the action, e.g. TargetInstance
subjectOid - the subject oid that is effected by this action
action - the audit action
message - the text describing the action taken
